TopicTitle: Kerbal Space Program PS4 and XBOX ONE Boxed Edition

Articles.Content: Is there going to be a boxed edition for the PS4 and XBOX ONE version of Kerbal Space Program?
I'd be willing to bet that their marketing people will make special editions.  After all, it's a good way to make more money.
There will be I think, I saw something about it a few months ago.

That could be interesting but with the rate at which KSP gets updated, I can't imagine the real use of a physical copy in a practical sense. I also saw some pre-release footage of KSP on the Xbox One from the DICE show. Too much yellow flashing in that MET bar for my taste, and some maybe true/maybe not words about mods not being allowed turned me off the idea. Too bad, too. My Mac is pretty old, I don't have Fundz for a new game computer yet, but I already have the 'Bone. If Squad lets users have access to at least informational tools like KAC and MJ, then I might reconsider. 

Edited April 20, 2016 by LameLefty
typos

I bought the HD remaster or Resident evil on Steam.

Then I bought it digitally on PS4.

Then I bought the physical release for it when it came out.

I would very much enjoy a physical copy of the game.
A physical copy is no barrier to updating... you just install your physical copy, then your console goes and grabs the latest version.

I bought the HD remaster or Resident evil on Steam.

Then I bought it digitally on PS4.

Then I bought the physical release for it when it came out.

I would very much enjoy a physical copy of the game.

hehe so you opened that door in that corridor late at night in the dark too a few year ago ? xDr

Sort of collector edition with some goodies and making of stuff, artbook and all, supporting this as well whenever if whenever if ; )
There isn't even a physical copy of the PC game.  I doubt they would.
